Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f2v to be added here... :-)
== Description: ==
One plant centered on page.
: Root: long straight rhizome, covered with scales or round stalk scars. : Stem: single, vertical, slightly bent, shooting out from middle of rhizome; dark painted. : Branches: there is the stub of a lost branch at mid-stalk. : Leaves: a single large leaf, horizontal, shaped like a very fat C, with smooth rim. Painted solid dark. : Stalk: short. : Flowers: one white flower, pointing almost straight up. : Stalk: long, light colored, with a darker vein; part of it obscured by leaf which should be behind it. : Chalyx: well-drawn, with thick tongue-shaped sepals, light colored. : Petals: well-drawn, flaring, lily shaped, serrated edges, white underpaint. : Core: not visible. : Stamen: long, with a few short hairs.
Two paragraphs (with lines, respectively), left- and right-justified: one at the top, interrupted by the single flower, and one just below mid-page, interrupted by the main stem.
== Comments: ==
The plant looks quite natural and well-drawn.
Presumably, the flower stem was in front of the leaf in the original drawing; but the dark overpaint covered it. The original outline of the leaf may have been obscured, too.
The leaf shape suggests it is a water plant. With that assumption, the choices are quite few. Rene suggested
'''Nymphaea candida (a.k.a. Nymphaea alba; water lily, seerose)'''
http://runeberg.org/nordflor/pics/181.jpg
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f3r to be added here...
==Description:==
One plant, flush against the right margin.
: Roots: a bunch of unbranched tentacle-like roots radiating from the stem's base. Light colored, partial dark overpaint. : Stem: rather thick, bent. Light colored, dark overpainted stripe (shadow) along its left side. : Branches: none. : Leaves: lance-shaped with an S bend, very dense, growing straight off the stem on both sides, each partially covering the previous one. Stem ends with one unpaired leaf. Light colored, with a dark-painted shadow on the bottom of each leaf, and a dotted line just inside the leaf's rim. : Flowers: none.
Four paragraphs (with 9.5, 3.5, 2.7, and 2.8 lines): a longer one at the top, and three short ones just below mid-page. The first two are left-justified and follow the plant's outline on the right. The last two are left- and right-justified, and interrupted by the main stem.
==Comments:==
The plant looks strange because of the dense leaves. Perhaps they are actually the sheaths of leafstalks, badly drawn? Perhaps the dots along the leaf rim are short spines?
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f3v to be added here... :-)
==Description:==
One plant, flush against the bottom and right margins of the page.
: Root: single long root, consisting of six "telescoping" conical segments, dark painted, with flat light-painted top. Tip of root is bent into a hook and ends with a small round knob. : Stem: long, straight, vertical, with a dark "shadow" stripe crudely painted along its length. : Branches: none. : Leaves: paired, disk shaped with two "tails", two "arms", and a swallowtail-shaped "head", with long outward-curved tips. : Stalks: medium length, thin. : Flowers: two, very unequal size, growing out of the tip of the stem. : Stalks: short, thin, like leaf stalks. : Calyx: heavy, swollen, shaped like a sweet potato cut in half, dark painted. : Petals: single row, light, semicircular, very small. : Core: flat, light-colored, filled with dots; looks like a pepper shaker.
Two paragraphs (with 6.0 and 7.5 lines), both in the top half of the page. The text is left-justified and follows the plant outline on the right.
==Comments:==
The plant looks quite strange. The telescoping root is hard to explain. The leaf shape is unusual but not impossible. The bloated flower chalices are very strange; they may have been drawn from pressed and dried specimens.
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f4r to be added here... :-)
==Description:==
One plant, mostly in the right half of the page.
Two paragraphs (with 3.8 and 8.6 lines), both above mid-page. The first is left- and right-justified, and interrupted once by the flowers; the second is left-justified and follows the plant's outline on the right.
==Comments:==
Plant appearance: very normal, exceptionally well-drawn. The layout of leaves and flowers is very naturalistic. The "dark painter" apparently spared it.
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f4v to be added here...
==Description:==
One plant, mostly in the right half of the page.
Two paragraphs, both above mid-page. The first is left- and right-justified; the second is left-justified, and follows the plant's profile on the right.
==Comments:==
Plant appearance: somewhat bizarre, and badly drawn. It seems to have two types of leaves. The lower ones are too small, badly spaced and badly proportioned, and in unnatural positions. The upper ones look like pompons. The root has a strange, ungainly shape (but that may be the work of the Dark Painter). The stems have uneven and unnatural thickness.
This drawing is almost certainly an expanded version of plant [[f101r1]][1,5]. Stolfi suggested that the person who drew this page thought that the star-shaped things in [[f101r1]][1,5] were flowers, so he supplied fantasy leaves; and he only noticed the mistake halfway through the plant.
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f5r to be added here... :-)
==Description:==
One plant, horizontally centered, reaching only 3/4 up the page.
: Root: five unbranched roots, mostly horizontal. Each root looks like an earthworm, light-colored with a few dark dots, with a short and fat swelling about 4/5 of the way to the tip.
: Stalk: straight, vertical, slightly tapered, uncolored(?).
: Leaves: a single ring of large, lance shaped leaves, closely spaced, attached mid-stem with no stalks. The leaves curl down in a semicircle, like an umbrella, until they almost touch the stem again; their thin tips curl further into hooks. Dark overpaint.
: Flowers: one, at tip of stem, pointing up.
: Stalk: medium, thin, uncolored(?); extension of stem.
: Chalix: thimble-shaped, partial dark overpaint.
: Petals: long, hair like, drooping.
: Core: hemispherical, like a bubble.
Two paragraphs (with 3.6 and 2.5 lines), both above the plant, left- and right-justified.
==Comments:==
The plant looks very strange but not impossible. The oddest details are the position of the tubers, the shape and disposition of the leaves, their curled tips, the "shaggy dog" flower.
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

Transcription, comments, theories, links to do with VMs page f5v to be added here...
==Description:==
One branching plant that takes up the lower 3/4 of the page.
: Root: two dark-painted potato-shaped tubers next to the stem, with a few medium-length "mousetail" roots shooting from them.
: Stem: straight and vertical, light under(?)color, with a fantastic loop at the top. The stem's base is wrapped with a short uncolored sheath.
: Branches: several, diagonal, mostly straight.
: Leaves: four lobes with serrated edges, naturalistically curved. Each lobe has a central vein.
: Stalks: medium-short, thin, look like branches. Light coulored, many of them with crudely overpainted dark splotches.
: Flowers: several, medium-small, mostly upright, some drooping.
: Stalk: short, sometimes bent by weight.
: Chalyx: rounded, light colored, like a rose's but on the fat side.
: Sepals: short and pointed, light colored.
: Petals: half a dozen, small, tongue-shaped, spread out; dark overpaint almost but not quite fills their outline.
One paragraph (5.5 lines) above the plant, left- and right-justified.
==Comments:==
The plant looks fairly normal, except for the fantastic loop in the stalk. Leaves and flowers are very naturalistic, but some are spoiled by the crude dark overpaint.
[[Category:The Voynich Manuscript]]

revision.comment: /* Coulomb's Law for Point Charges */ spelling
revision.text:
{{Electrodynamics}}
== Coulomb's Law for Point Charges ==
The repulsive or attractive '''electrostatic force''' between two point charges is determined by an equation called '''Coulomb's law'''. Consider the situation where we have two charges, labeled for convenience ''q'', and ''Q'' ("q" or "Q" are common variables to describe a point charge, and we will use these letters to describe charges throughtout this book). The following picture shows charge ''q'' at a certain point with charge ''Q'' at a distance of ''r'' away from it. The presence of ''Q'' causes an electrostatic force to be exerted on ''q''. The distance vector between ''Q'' and ''q'' is '''r'''.
[[image:Coulomb's_Law_between_2_Charges.PNG|center]]
Using '''Coulomb's Law''', we can find the strength of the electric force between these two charges:
{{eqn|Coulomb's Law}} :<math>F = k_\mathrm{e} \frac {q Q}{r^2}</math> Where: <math>k_\mathrm{e}</math> = Coulomb's constant = ''8.9875 × 10<sup>9</sup> N·m<sup>2</sup>/C<sup>2</sup>'' in free space.
{{SideBox|Students who have studied Gravity may recognize that Coulomb's Law looks very similar in form to Newton's Law of Universal Gravitation.}}
The magnitude of the electrostatic force ''F'', on charge ''q'', due to charge ''Q'', equals '''Coulomb's constant''' times the product of the two charges (in coulombs) divided by the square of the distance ''r'', between the charges ''q'' and ''Q''. {{-}}
== Dielectrics ==
The value of Coulomb's constant given here is such that the preceding Coulomb's Law equation will work if both ''q'' and ''Q'' are given in units of coulombs, ''r'' in meters, and ''F'' in newtons and there is no dielectric material between the charges. A '''dielectric material''' is one that reduces the electrostatic force when placed between charges. Furthermore, Coulomb's constant can be given by:
{{eqn|Coulomb's Constant}} :<math>k = \frac {1}{4 \pi \epsilon }</math>
where ε = '''permittivity'''. When there is no dielectric material between the charges (for example, in free space or a vacuum),
{{eqn|Permittivity of free space}} :<math>\epsilon _0 = 8.85419 \times 10^{-12} \frac{C^2}{(N \dot m^2)}</math>
Air is only very weakly dielectric and the value above for ε<sub>0</sub> will work well enough with air between the charges. If a dielectric material is present, then:
:<math>\epsilon = \kappa \epsilon _0\,</math>
where κ is the '''dielectric constant''' which depends on the dielectric material. In a vacuum (free space), κ = 1 and thus ε = ε<sub>0</sub>. For air, κ = 1.0006. Typically, solid insulating materials have values of κ > 1 and will reduce electric force between charges. The dielectric constant can also be called '''relative permittivity''', symbolized as ε<sub>r</sub> in [[Wikipedia:Dielectric|Wikipedia]].
This shows that the electric force between the charges decreases as the charges are located further from each other by the square of the distance between them. As the charges become located further enough apart, their effect on each other becomes negligible.
== Force Vectors ==
Any force on an object is a vector quantity. In a force vector, the direction is the one in which the force pulls the object. The symbol '''F''' is used here for the electric force vector. If charges ''q'' and ''Q'' are either both positive or both negative, then they will repel each other. This means the direction of the electric force '''F''' on ''q'' due to ''Q'' is away from ''Q'' in exactly the opposite direction, as shown by the red arrow in the preceding diagram. If one of the charges is positive and the other negative, then they will attract each other. This means that the direction of '''F''' on ''q'' due to ''Q'' is exactly in the direction towards ''Q'', as shown by the blue arrow in the preceding diagram. The Coulomb's equation shown above will give a magnitude for a repulsive force away from the ''Q'' charge. If the magnitude given by the above equation is negative due to opposite charges, the direction of the resulting force will be towards ''Q'', an attractive force. In other sources, different variations of Coulombs' Law are given, including vector formulas in some cases (see Wikipedia link and reference(s) below).
=== Vector Form ===
We can ''vectorize'' Coulomb's Law to use position and force vectors instead of scalar quantities. We can express the location of charge ''q'' as '''r'''<sub>q</sub>, and the location of charge ''Q'' as '''r'''<sub>Q</sub>. In this way we can know both how strong the electric force is on a charge, but also what direction that force is directed in. Coulomb's Law using vectors can be written as:
{{eqn|Coulomb's Law (vectors)}} :<math>\mathbf{F} = \frac{kqQ(\mathbf{r}_q - \mathbf{r}_Q)}{|\mathbf{r}_q - \mathbf{r}_Q|^3}</math>
If we have '''r''' = '''r'''<sub>q</sub> - '''r'''<sub>Q</sub>, and ''r'' = |'''r'''|, then we can rewrite this equation as:
:<math>\mathbf{F} = \frac{kqQ\mathbf{r}}{r^3}</math>
The vector '''F''' is a force vector that shows the direction and the magnitude of the force.
=== ''n'' Charges ===
In many situations, there may be many charges, ''Q<sub>1</sub>'', ''Q<sub>2</sub>'', ''Q<sub>3</sub>'', through ''Q<sub>n</sub>'', on the charge ''q'' in question. Each of the ''Q<sub>1</sub>'' through ''Q<sub>n</sub>'' charges will exert an electric force on q. The direction of the force depends on the location of the surrounding charges. A Coulomb's Law calculation between ''q'' and a corresponding ''Q<sub>i</sub>'' charge would give the magnitude of the electric force exerted by each of the ''Q<sub>i</sub>'' charges for ''i = 1'' through ''n'', '''but''' the direction of each of the component forces must also be used to determine the individual force vectors, '''F'''<sub>1</sub>, '''F'''<sub>2</sub>, '''F'''<sub>3</sub>, ...., '''F'''<sub>n</sub>. To determine the total electric force on ''q'', the electric force contributions from each of these charges add up as '''vector''' quantities, not just like ordinary (or scalar) numbers.
:<math>\vec {F_e} = \vec {F_1} + \vec {F_2} + \vec {F_3} + ..... + \vec {F_n}</math>
The total electric force on ''q'' can be added to any other forces affecting it as a '''vector''' quantity to obtain the total force vector on the charged object ''q''. In many cases, there are billions of electrons or other charges present, so that geometrical distributions of charges are used with equations stemming from Coulomb's Law.
We can re-write Coulomb's law as a sum of ''n'' charges:
{{eqn|Coulomb's Law (n charges)}} :<math>\mathbf{F_n} = \sum_{i \ne n} \frac{q_n q_i(\mathbf{r}_n - \mathbf{r}_i)}{4 \pi \epsilon_0|\mathbf{r}_n - \mathbf{r}_i|^3}</math>

revision.text:
'''Linguistics''' is the study of human language(s) by scientific method(s) in the spoken, written and preconscious form.
Languages that cannot be reliably classified into any family are known as language isolates.
In the scientific practice of linguistics, several distinct areas of study are recognized. Each represents a different aspect or level of abstraction. These range from Phonetics--the study of the acoustic, anatomical, and other such aspects of the physical production or qualities of vocal sounds; to syntax--the study of the rules and organization of words and the relationships existing between them.
* '''Phonetics''' is the study and systematic classification of the sounds made in spoken utterance. * '''Phonology''' is the study and description of the sound changes in a language. * '''Morphology''' is the study of the internal structure of words. * '''Syntax''' is the study of the structure of phrases, sentences and language. * '''Semantics''' is the study of the relationship between words and their meanings. * '''Pragmatics''' is the study of how meaning changes according to context. * '''Stylistics''' is the study of why a particular choice of language is used in a particular context.
=== Computational Linguistics ===
An interdisciplinary field dealing with the statistical and logical modeling of [[Wikipedia:natural language | natural language]] from a computational perspective. This modeling is not limited to any particular field of linguistics.
There are two major purposes of computational linguistics: # To help linguists study natural languages more easily # To make it possible for ordinary people to use natural language when using a computer
Computational linguists often use large bodies of digitized text or speech called [[Wikipedia:Text corpus | corpora]] as a basis for teaching computer programs the proper use of a language, or to compare the use of a language in one context to it's use in another context. This is also called [[#Corpus.5CText Linguistics | corpus linguistics]].
Some of the practical uses of computational linguistics include: * [[Wikipedia:Speech recognition | Speech recognition]] * [[Wikipedia:Speech synthesis | Speech production]] * [[Wikipedia:Machine translation | Machine translation]] * Improvements to [[Wikipedia:data mining | data mining]], including [[Wikipedia:search engine | search engine]] design.
''See Also: [[Wikipedia:computational linguistics]]''
{{Alphabetical|S}} {{Subjects|Linguistics}} {{status|0%}}

My name is Pieter Jansegers.
I'm a teacher of French in the Dutch speaking part of Belgium.
I did study French and Italian (both litterature and linguistics) at the University of Ghent.
I'm an ICT enthusiast and my contribution on this system will be concentrated on three points:
1) French
2) linguistics
3) ICT use in general

==Demostraciones de límites==
Teniendo en cuenta la definición de límite demuestre que los límites pedidos existen
1)<math>\lim_{x\to 4} 3x-7=5</math> :Análisis Preliminar :Si el límite existe se debe cumplir: :0 < |x-4| < δ → |(3x-7)-5| < ε :Consideremos la parte derecha :|(3x-7)-5| < ε :|3x-12| < ε :|3(x-4)| < ε :|3| |x-4| < ε :|x-4| < <math>\frac {\epsilon} {3}</math> :Sea δ >0, se elige un δ = <math>\frac {\epsilon} {3}</math> :0 < |x-4| < δ → |x-4| < <math>\frac {\epsilon} {3}</math> : →|x-4| |3| < ε : →|3x-12| < ε : →|(3x-7)-5| < ε : ■ [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
2)<math>\lim_{x \ to 4} \frac {1} {2} x +3 = 5</math> :Analisis Preliminar :Si el límite existe, se debe cumplir: :0 < |x-4| < δ → |<math>\frac {1} {2} x</math> +3 -5| < ε :Consideremos la parte derecha :|\<math>frac {1} {2} x</math> +3 -5| < ε : |<math>\frac {1} {2} x</math>-2| < ε : 2|<math>\frac {1} {2} x</math> -2| < 2ε : |x-4|< 2ε :Sea δ >0, se elige un δ = 2ε :0 < |x-4| < δ → |x-4|< 2ε : → |<math>\frac {|x-4|} {|2|}|</math> < ε : → |<math>\frac {1} {2}</math> x-2|< ε : → |(<math>\frac {1} {2}</math>x+3)-5| < ε : ■ [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
3)<math>\lim_{x \ to1} \frac {2x^2+2x-4} {x-1} = 6</math> :Análisis Preliminar : Si el límite existe se debe cumplir: :0 < |x-1| < δ → |<math>\frac {2x^2+2x-4} {x-1}</math> - 6| < ε :Consideremos la parte derecha :|<math>\frac {2x^2+2x-4} {x-1}</math> - 6| < ε :6 - ε < <math>\frac {2x^2+2x -4} {x-1}</math> < ε +6 :6 - ε < <math>\frac {2(x^2+x -2)} {x-1}</math> < ε +6 :6 - ε < <math>\frac {2(x-1)(x+2)} {x-1}</math> < ε +6 :6 - ε < 2(x+2) < ε+6 :3-<math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> < x+2 < <math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> +3 :-<math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> < x+1 <<math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> :|x-1| < <math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> :Sea δ >0, se elige un δ = <math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> :0 < |x-1| < δ → |x-1| < <math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> : →|x-1|< <math>\frac {\epsilon} {2}</math> : → -<math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math>< x-1 < <math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math> : →3-<math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math>< x-1+3<<math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math>+3 : →3-<math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math>< x+2 <<math>\frac{\epsilon}{2}</math>+3 : →<math>\frac{6-\epsilon}{2}</math>< x+2<<math>\frac{6+\epsilon}{2}</math> : →6-ε < 2(x+2) < 6+ε : → -ε < 2(x+2)+6 < ε : →|2(x+2)+6| <ε : →|<math>\frac {x-1} {x-1}</math>| |2(x+2)-6| < ε : →|<math>\frac {2(x+2)(x-1)}{x-1}</math> - <math>\frac {6(x-1)} {x-1}</math>| < ε : →|<math>\frac {2(x^2-x+2x+2)} {x-1}</math> -6| < ε : →|<math>\frac {2x^2+2x+4} {x-1}</math> -6 | < ε : ■ [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
4)<math> \lim_{x \ to 3} \sqrt{3x-5} = 2</math> :Análisis Preliminar :Si el límite existe, se debe cumplir: :0 < |x-3| < δ → |<math>\sqrt {3x-5}</math> - 2| < ε :Consideremos la parte derecha :|<math>\sqrt {3x-5}</math> - 2| < ε :|<math>\sqrt {3x-5} - 2|^2</math> < <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|<math>(\sqrt {3x-5})^2 - (2)^2</math>| < <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|3x-5-4|< <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|3x-9|< <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|3(x-3)| < <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|3| |x-3| < <math>\epsilon^2</math> :|x-3| < <math>\frac {\epsilon^2} {3}</math> :Sea δ >0, se elige un δ = <math>\frac {\epsilon^2} {3}</math> :0 < |x-3| < δ → |x-3| < <math>\frac {\epsilon^2} {3}</math> : →|3x-9| < <math>\epsilon^2</math> : →|(3x-5)-4| < <math>\epsilon ^2</math> : →|<math>\sqrt{3x-5} - \sqrt{4}</math>| < <math>\sqrt{\epsilon^2}</math> : →|<math>\sqrt{3x-5}</math> - 2| < ε : ■ [[User:Emilia|Emilia]]
----
==Derivadas== Encontrar las derivadas pedidas
1)Derivar:<math>\ y=x^2+2x+17 </math> :<math>\ y'=2x+2 </math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 2)Derivar:<math>\ y=(x+4)(2x+3)</math> :<math>\ y'=x(2x+3)+ 2(x+4)</math> :<math>\ 2x^2+3x+2x+4</math> :<math>\ 2x^2+5x+4</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 3)Derivar:<math>y= \frac{2x+1}{x+6}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{2(x+6)-1(2x+1)}{(x+6)^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac {2x+12-2x+1}{(x+6)^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{11}{(x+6)^2}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 4)Derivar:<math>\ y^3+7y=x^3</math> :<math>\ 3y^2y'+7y=3x^2</math> :<math>\ y'= \frac{3x^2}{3y^2+7}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 5)Derivar:<math>y= \frac{e^(2x+3)}{(x+1)^2}</math> :<math>y'= \frac {e^(2x+3) 2(x+1)^2-2(x+1)e^2x+3}{(x+1)^4}</math> :<math>y'= \frac {(x+1)[e^(2x+3)2(x+1)-e^2x+3]}{(x+1)^4} </math> :<math>y'= \frac {e^(2x+3) 2(x+1)-2e^2x+3}{(x+1)^3}</math> :<math>y'= \frac {2e^(2x+3) [(x+1)-1]}{(x+1)^3}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 6)Derivar:<math>\ y=3x^4x^3+2x-5</math> :<math>y'= 3x^4x^3+2x-5 [\frac{3 (4x^3+2x-5}{3x}+12x^2+2(ln3x)]</math> :<math>y'= 3x^4x^3+2x-5 [\frac{ (4x^3+2x-5}{x}+12x^2+2(ln3x)]</math> :<math>\ y'= 3x^4x^3+2x-5 [\frac{ (4x^3+2x-5+12x^2+2)(ln3x)}{x}]</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 7)Derivar: <math>\ y^2+x^2=16</math> :<math>\ 2yy'+2x=0</math> :<math>\ 2yy'= -2x</math> :<math>\ y'= \frac{-2x}{2y}</math> :<math>\ y' = \frac {-x}{y}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 8)Derivar:<math>f(x)= \frac {1}{x+1}</math> :<math>\ f'(x)= \frac {-1}{(x+1)^2}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
==Derivadas Trigonometricas==
1)Derivar:<math>\ y=Cos^-1x</math> :<math>\ Cosy=x</math> :<math>\ -Senyy'=1</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{1}{-seny}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{-1}{\sqrt{1-cos^2y}}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{-1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 2)Derivar:<math>\ y=tan^-1x</math> :<math>\ tany=x</math> :<math>\ sec^2yy'=1</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{1}{sec^2y}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{1}{1+tan^2y}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{1}{1+x^2}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 3)Derivar<math>\ y=sec^-1x</math> :<math>\ secy=x</math> :<math>\ (tany secy)y'=1</math> :<math>y'=\frac{1}{tany secy}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{1}{secy\sqrt{sec^2-1}}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{1}{x\sqrt{x^2-1}}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]]
4)Derivar:<math>\ y=csc^-1x</math> :<math>\ cscy=x</math> :<math>\ (-cscy ctgy)y'=1</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{1}{-cscy ctgy}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{-1}{cscy \sqrt{csc^2y-1}}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac{-1}{x\sqrt{x^2-1}}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
5)Derivar:<math>\ y= (sen(x)+tan(x)) (sec(x)-tan(x))</math> :<math>\ y'=(tan(x)sec(x)+sec(x)^2)(sec(x)-tan(x))+(tan(x)sec(x)-sec(x)^2)(sec(x)tan(x))</math> :<math>\ y'=(tan(x)sec(x)+sec(x)^2)(sec(x)-tan(x))+(tan(x)sec(x)-sec(x)^2)(sec(x)+tan(x))</math> :<math>\ y'=(tan(x)sec(x)^2-tan(x)^2sec(x)+sec(x)^3-sec(x)^2tan(x))+(tan(x)sec(x)^2+tan(x)^2sec(x)-sec(x)^3-sec(x)^2tan(x))</math> :<math>\ y'= -tan(x)^2sec(x)+sec(x)^3+tan(x)^2sec(x)-sec(x)^3</math> :<math>\ y'= 0 </math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 6)Derivar:<math>\ y=e^(2x) arccos(3x+1)</math> :<math>y'= e^(2x) 2x arccos(3x+1)+e^2x\frac{3}{\sqrt{1-(3x+1)}}</math> :<math>y'= e^(2x) 2x arccos(3x+1)+e^2x\frac{3}{\sqrt{-3x}}</math> :<math>y'= e^(2x) (2xarccos(3x+1)+\frac{3}{\sqrt{-3x}}</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 7)Derivar: <math>\ y= 6^(tan^2(3x))</math> :<math>\ y'= 6^(tan^2(3x)) ln6 2tan(3x) sec^2(3x) 3</math> :<math>\ y'= 6^(tan^2(3x)) ln6 6tan(3x) sec^2(3x) 3</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 8)Derivar:<math>f(x)= \frac {1}{x^2+1}+x^5cos(x)</math> :<math>f'(x)= \frac {-2x}{(x^2+1)^2}+5x^4cos(x)-sen(x)x^5</math> [[User:Emilia|Emilia]]
luz [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ---- 2)Erica tiene 200 pies de valla con la cual planea encerrar un patio rectangular para su perro. Si desea encerrar el area máxima, cuáles serian las dimensiones de esta?
:<math>200=2y+2x *</math> :<math>A=xy</math> :despejamos y en * <math>y=100-x</math> :reemplazando <math>A=x(100-x)</math> : <math>A=100x-x^2</math> :derivando <math>A'=100-2x</math> :igualando a cero <math> 0=100-2x</math> :despejando <math>-2x=-100</math> : <math>x=\frac{-100}{-2}</math> : <math>x=50</math> :reemplazando x en * <math>200=2y+2(50)</math> :despejando y <math> 2y=200-100</math> : <math>2y=100</math> : <math>y=50</math> Las dimensiones para encerrar el area máxima serian x=50; y=50 (Tomado del Cálculo de Purcell) [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----
==Razón de Cambio==
1) Una escalera de 2m está apoyada contra una pared, la base de la escalera resbala alejandose de la pared, a razón de 0.3m/s. ¿Con qué rapidez desciende el extremo superior de la escalera cuando se encuentra a 0.8m del piso?
:<math>\frac{dx}{dt}=0.3m/s</math> :<math>\frac{dy}{dt}=? cuando x=0.8m</math> :<math>y^2+x^2=4</math> :<math>2yy'+2xx'=0*</math> :<math>Si x=0.8</math> :<math>y^2+0.64=4</math> :<math>y^2=4-0.64</math> :<math>y=\sqrt{3.36}</math> :<math>y=1.83</math> :reemplazando en * :<math>2(1.83)y'+2(0.3)(0.8)=0</math> :<math>3.66y'=-0.48</math> :<math>y'=-0.13</math>
La escalera desciende con una rapidez de 0.13m/s [[User:Emilia|Emilia]] ----

1) <math>lim_{x\to 0}\frac {3xtanx}{senx}</math> :=<math>lim_{x\to 0}\frac {3xsenx/cosx}{senx}</math> :=<math>lim_{x\to 0}\frac {3xsenx}{senxcosx}</math> :=<math>\frac {0}{1}</math> :=<math>\ 0</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]] ---- 2) <math>lim_{x\to 0}\frac {sen3x}{2x}</math> :=<math>3/3lim_{x\to 0}\frac {sen3x}{2x}</math> :=<math>3*lim_{x\to 0}\1/3\frac {sen3x}{2x}</math> :=<math>2/2*3lim_{x\to 0}\frac {senx}{2x}</math> :=<math>3/2lim_{x\to 0}\frac {senx}{x}</math> :=<math>\frac {2}{3}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
3)Derive: <math>\ y=3x^2-1/4x+3</math> :<math>y'=\frac{6x(4x+3)-(3x^2-1)4}{(4x+3)^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{12x^2+18x+4}{(4x+3)^2}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]] ---- 4)Derive:<math>\ y=1/2x(4-x^5)+\frac{3x-1}{x}</math> :<math>y'=1/2x(-5x^4)+(4-x^5)1/2+\frac{3*x-(3x-1)*1}{x^2}</math> :=<math>-5/2x^5+2-1/2x^5+\frac{3x-3x+1}{x^2}</math> :=<math>-3x^5+2+\frac{1}{x^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{-3x^7+2x^2+1}{x^2}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]] ---- 5)Derive:<math>\ y=\frac{2x^2-4x+3}{2-3x}</math> :<math>y^=\frac{(4x-4)(2-3x)-(2x^2-4x+3)(-3)}{(2-3x)^2}</math> :=<math>\frac{(-12x^2+20x-8)-(-6x^2+12x-9)}{(2-3x)^2}</math> :<math>y'(x)=\frac{-6x^2+8x+1}{(2-3x)^2}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]] ---- 6)Derive:<math>\ y=(3x-2x^2)(5+4x)</math> :<math>y'=(3x-2x^2)(4)+(5+4x)(3-4x)</math> :<math>y'=12x-8x^2)+(15-8x-16X^2)</math> :<math>y'=-24x^2+4x+15</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]] ----- hallar primera y segunda derivada 7)<math>y=x^3+3x^2+6x</math> :<math>y'=3x^2+6x+6</math> :<math>y''=6x+6</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
8)<math>y=senx^3</math> :<math>y'=(cosx^3)(3x^2)</math> :<math>y''=(-senx^3*3x^2)(3x^2)+(cosx^3)(6x)</math> :<math>y''=9x^4senx^3+6xcosx^3</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
9)<math>y=\frac{3x}{1-x}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{(3)(1-x)-(3x)(-1)}{(1-x)^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{3-3x+3x}{(1-x)^2}</math> :<math>y'=\frac{3}{(1-x)^2}</math> :<math>y''=\frac{(0)(1-x)^2-(3)(2(x-1)(-1))}{(1-x)^4}</math> :<math>y''=\frac{6(1-x)}{(1-x)^4}</math> :<math>y''=\frac{6}{(1-x^3)}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
10)<math>y=(3x+5)^3</math> :<math>Y'=3(3x+5)^2(3)</math> :<math>y'=9(3x+5)^2</math> :<math>y''=18(3x+5)(3)</math> :<math>y''=54(3x+5)</math> :<math>y''=162x+270</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
Derivar implicitamente 11)<math>2xy=(x^2+y^2)^3/2</math> :<math>Dx(2xy)=Dx(x^2+y^2)^3/2</math> :<math>(2x)(y')+2y=3/2(x^2+y^2)^1/2(2x+yy')</math> :<math>2xy'+2y=3x(x^2+y^2)^1/2+3(x^2+y^2)^1/2yy'</math> :<math>2xy'-3(x^2+y^2)^1/2yy'=3(x^2+y^2)^1/2-2y</math> :<math>y'(2x-3y/x^2+y^2)^1/2))=3x(x^2+y^2)^1/2-2y</math> :<math>y'=\frac{3x(x^2+y^2)^1/2-2y}{2x-3y/x^2+y^2)^1/2}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
12)<math>y^3+y^2-5y-x^2=-4</math> :<math>3y^2y'+2yy'-5y'-2x=0</math> :<math>y'(3y^2+2y-5)=2x</math> :<math>y'=\frac{2x}{3y^2+2y-5}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
13)<math>xy+xy^2=6</math> :<math>xy'+y*1+x*2yy'+y^2*1=0</math> :<math>xy'+y+2xyy'+y^2=0</math> :<math>y'(x+2xy)=-y-y^2</math> :<math>y'=\frac-{y+y^2}{x+2xy}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
14)<math>y^2=x^4+x^2y^2</math> :<math>2yy'=4x^3+x^2*2yy'+y^2*2x</math> :<math>y'(2y-2x^2y)=4x^3+2xy^2</math> :<math>y'=\frac{4x^3+2xy^2}{2y-2x^2y}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
15)<math>xseny+cos2y=cosy</math> :<math>(x)(cosyy')+(seny)+(-sen2y)*2y'=(-senyy')</math> :<math>xcosyy'-2(sen2y)y'+senyy'=-seny</math> :<math>y'(xcosy-2seny+seny)=-seny</math> :<math>y'=\frac{-seny}{xcosy-2seny+seny}</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]
Problemas de razones de cambio relacionadas
16)De un tubo sale arena a razon de 16 pies^3/seg, si la arena al caer siempre forma un cono cuya altura siempre es 1/4 del tamaño de la base que tan rapido aumenta h cuando el monton tiene una h de 4 pies.
ANS: se sabe que h= 4 pies, y nos preguntan dh/dt es decir la razon de cambio de la altura con respecto al tiempo y tambien se sabe que 16pies^3/seg es dv/dt es decir la razon de cambio del volumen con respecto al tiempo.
:<math>V=1/3pir^2h</math> :<math>V=1/3pi(2h)^2h</math> :<math>V=1/3pi(4h^2)h</math> :<math>\frac{dv}{dt}=\frac{4pi}{3}*3h^2\frac{dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac{dv}{dt}=4pi*h^2\frac{dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac{dh}{dt}=\frac{dv}{dt}*\frac{1}{4pih^2}</math> :<math>\frac{dh}{dt}=16pies^3/seg*\frac{1}{64pi}</math> :<math>\frac{dh}{dt}=0.0795pies^3/seg</math> [[User:Victorpollo|Victorpollo]]

==DERIVADAS== ---- 1)Derivar:<math>F(x)=x^4-7x^2+6</math> :<math>F'(x)=4x^3-14x</math> --[[User:Corredorclau|Corredorclau]] 14:08, 12 Jul 2004 (UTC) ---- 2)Derivar:<math>F(x)=5x^2-2x-7</math> :<math>F'(x)=10x-2</math> --[[User:Corredorclau|Corredorclau]] 14:15, 12 Jul 2004 (UTC) ---- 3)Derivar:<math>F(x)=(2x^-5)^2</math> :<math>F'(x)=2(2x^2-5)(4x)</math> :<math>F'(x)=(4x^2-10)(4x)</math> :<math>F'(x)=16x^3-40

==MÁXIMOS Y MINIMOS==
1) Al lado de un gran muro de una granja. se quiere cercar un terreno que tenga forma rectangular. Se dispone solamente de 100 metros de malla de alambre para construir la cerca para que esta encierre la mayor parte de área posible.
:<math>A=xy</math> :<math>2x+y=100</math> :<math>y=100-2x</math> :<math>A=x(100+2x)</math> :<math>A=100x-2x^2</math> :<math>A'=100-4x</math> :<math>A'=0</math> :<math>100-4x=0</math> :<math>-4x=-100</math> :<math>x=\frac {100}{4}</math> :<math>x=25</math>
:<math>y=100-2x</math> :<math>y=100-50</math> :<math>y=25</math>
:<math>A=xy</math> :<math>A=25(50)</math> :<math>A=1250 metros</math>
[[User:Corredorclau|Corredorclau]]
''2) cual es la maxima area que puede tener un triangulo rectangulo cuya hipotenusa tenga 5cm de largo.
Por pitagoras :<math>Z^2=x^2+y^2</math> :<math>z=5</math> :<math>x^2+y^2=25</math> :<math>y=\sqrt{25-x^2}</math> area del triangulo :<math>A=\frac{xy}{2}</math> :<math>A=x(\frac{\sqrt{25-x^2}}{2})</math> :<math>\frac{1}{2}\sqrt{25-x^2}+(\frac({x}{2})(\frac{-2x}{2(\sqrt{25-x^2})}=0</math> :<math>\frac{25-x^2-x^2}{2\sqrt{25-x^2}}=0</math> :<math>25-2x^2=0</math> :<math>x=\sqrt{\frac{25}{2}}</math> :<math>y=\sqrt{25-\frac{25}{2}}</math> :<math>y=\sqrt{\frac{25}{2}}</math> :<math>A=\frac{\sqrt{\frac{25}{2}}}{\sqrt{\frac{25}{2}}}{2}</math> :<math>A=\frac{25}{4}cm^2</math> [[User:Corredorclau|Corredorclau]]''

==Dedicatoria== Esta pagina como cualquier pansamiento de calculo por mas minimo que sea se lo dedico al Profesor Alejandro Bello en muestra, de que si fuy capas y que muchas veces la perdida de una materia no es absoluta culpa del alumno si no tambien del profesor. Manos mal en este vacional, enconre a tres profesores aunque solo nos tocara dos, y cada uno mas que dejarme conocimientos de calculo, me devolvieron la confianza y el cariño natural que siente una ingeniera por el calculo.
Lina Maria Rincón Sotelo
==Agradecimiento== Es para mi extraño escribir un agradecimiento sin hacer uso de la tinta, pero lo importante es la inspiración que proviene de la satisfaccion de lo echo y aun mas cuando existe tanta dedicacion y esfuerzo de mi parte. Pero como yo no soy autosufiente ha personas a las cuales le agradesco, empesemos por mi papá, gracias papi pues eres el es que paga la cuenta de internet para q yo pueda trabajar en este proyecto y asi no me tire calculo por insegura, tambien debo agradecer a Camilo mi monitor por sus exelentes claras y concisas explicaciones, a el profe Offray ya que gracias a el aprendi utilizar un editor de ecuaciones, por compartir con nosotros experiencias de las cuales siempre me acordare y tendre presentes y ademas por no tomar represarias por vernos mi, a Pablito y Jaimito donde el paisa.
Lina Maria Rincon Sotelo
==Axiomas==
:'''Demuestre''':
1.<math>\ F(x)= \sqrt[2]{{2}} </math> es irracional :'''Demostración''': :Se supone que <math>\ F(x)= \sqrt[2]{{2}} </math> es <math>\frac {p}{q}</math>; Existe un m.c.d. de <math>\frac {p}{q} = 1 , q </math> diferente de <math>\ 0 </math> :(1)<math>\ F(x)= \sqrt[2]{{2}} = \frac {p}{q}</math> Por Hipotesis :(2)<math>\ F(x)= 2 = \frac {p^2}{q^2}</math> Por Notancion :(3)<math>\ p^2 = 2.q^2 </math> impica <math>\ p^2 = </math> numero par entero positivo implica, <math> p = </math> número entero positivo :(4)p es par; exixte un m q pertenece a los naturales tal que <math> p = 2m </math> :(5)<math>\ p^2 = 2q^2 </math> :(6)<math>\ (2m)^2 = 2q^2 </math> Reemplazando (4)en(5) :(7)<math>\ 4m^2 = 2q^2 </math> :(8)<math>\ 2m^2 = q^2 </math> :(9)<math>\ q^2 </math> = es un numero par y esto implica que : q es un numero par : por lo tanto esto contradice que el m. c. d. entre p/q sea 1 [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]] ---- 2.Demuestre que si <math>\ a^2 < b^2 </math> implica <math>\ a < b </math> :'''Demostración''': :(1)<math>\ a, b, c </math> pertenecen a los reales Por Hipotesis :(2)<math>\ a^2 < b^2 </math> Por Hipotesis :(3)<math>\ b^2 - a^2 < 0 </math> :(4)<math>\ (a+b)(a-b)> 0 </math> :(5)<math>\ b - a > 0 </math> por que <math>\ b + a < 0 </math> :(6)<math>\ b > a </math> :(7)<math>\ a < b </math> [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]] ---- 3.Demuestre que si <math> \frac {1} {a} > \frac {1} {b} </math> implica <math>\ a < b </math> :'''Demostración''': :(1)<math>\ a, b, 1 </math> pertenecen a los reales Por Hipotesis :(2)<math> \frac {1} {a} > \frac {1} {b} </math> :(3)<math> \frac {1} {a} - \frac {1} {b} > 0 </math> :(4)<math>\ a.b \frac ({1} {a} - \frac {1} {b}) > 0(a.b) </math> por teorema 10 :(5)<math> \frac {a.b} {a} - \frac {a.b} {b} > 0 </math> :(6)<math>\ b - a > 0 </math> :(7)<math>\ a < b </math> Por Propiedad Simetrica de la Igualdad [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]] ---- 4.Demuestre que si <math>\ a < b </math> implica <math>\ a < \frac {1} {a} > \frac {1} {b} < b </math> :'''Demostración''': :(1)<math>\ a, b </math>pertenecen a los reales.Por Hipotesis :(2)<math>\ a < b </math> :(3)<math>\ a + a < a + b , b + a < b + b </math> :(4)<math>\ 2a < a.b , b.a < 2b </math> por teorema 10 :(5)<math>\ a < \frac {a + b} {2} , \frac {b + a} {2} < b </math> :(6)<math>\ a < \frac {a + b} {2} < b </math> [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]]
==Inecuaciones==
1.Reuelva: :<math>\ |2x-1| </math> mayor o igual <math>\ |x+1| </math> :'''Respuesta''': :<math>\ {|2x-1|}^2 </math>mayor o igual<math>\ {|x+1|}^2 </math> :<math>\ {(2x-1)}^2 </math>mayor o igual<math>\ {(x+1)}^2 </math> :<math>\ {(2x-1)}^2 - {(x+1)}^2 </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ {((2x-1)+(x+1))} {((2x-1)-(x+1))} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ {(2x-1+x+1)} {(2x-1-x-1)} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ {(3x)} {(x-2)} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ {(3x)} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> , <math>\ {(x-2)} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ {x} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 0 </math> , <math>\ {x} </math>mayor o igual<math>\ 2 </math> :<math>\ (-infinito,0] </math> unido <math>\ [2,+infinito) </math> [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]] ---- 2.Reuelva: :<math>\ -5 </math> menor o igual <math>\ 2x+6 <4 </math> :'''Respuesta''': :<math>\ -5 </math>menor o igual<math>\ 2x+6 </math> ; <math>\ 2x+6 < 4 </math> :<math>\ -5-6</math>menor o igual<math>\ 2x </math> ; <math>\ 2x<4-6 </math> :<math>\ -11</math>menor o igual<math>\ 2x </math> ; <math>\ 2x<-2 </math> :<math>\frac{-11}{2}</math>menor o igual<math> {x} ; x<\frac{-2}{2} </math> :<math>\frac{-11}{2}</math>menor o igual <math>\ x< -1 </math> :<math>\ [\frac {-11}{2},1) </math> [[User:"Lina Rincon"|"Lina Rincon"]] ---- 3.Reuelva: :<math>\frac {x}{4+x} </math> menor o igual <math>\frac {1}{x-1}</math> :'''Respuesta''': :<math>\frac {x}{4+x} </math> - <math>\frac {1}{x-1}</math> menor o igual <math>\ 0</math> :<math>\frac {x^2+x-4-x}{(4+x)(x+1)} </math> menor o igual <math>\ 0</math> :<math>\frac {x^2-4}{(4+x)(x+1)} </math> menor o igual <math>\ 0</math> :<math>\frac {(x-2)(x+2)}{(4+x)(x+1)} </math> menor o igual <math>\ 0</math> Relizamos sementerio y la rta es <math>\ (-4,-2]</math> u <math>\ (-1,2]</math> ---- 4.Reuelva: :<math>\ 7+|3x-5|</math> menor o igual <math>\ 15</math> :'''Respuesta''': :Despejando tenemos :<math>\ |3x-5|</math> menor o igual <math>\ 15-7</math> :<math>\ |3x-5|</math> menor o igual <math>\ 8</math> :Es decir que :<math>\ -8</math>menor o igual<math>\ 3x-5</math> menor o igual <math>\ 8</math> :<math>\ -3</math>menor o igual<math>\ 3x</math> menor o igual <math>\ 13</math> :<math>\frac {-3}{3}</math>menor o igual<math>\ 3x</math> menor o igual <math>\frac {13}{3}</math> :<math>\ -1</math>menor o igual<math>\ 3x</math> menor o igual <math>\frac {13}{3}</math> Rta <math>\ [-1,\frac{13}{3}]</math> ---- 5.Reuelva: :<math>\ |3-2x|</math> > <math>\ |x+1|</math> :'''Respuesta''': :<math>\ {(3-2x)}^2</math> > <math>\ {(x+1)}^2</math> :<math>\ {(3-2x)}^2</math> - <math>\ {(x+1)}^2</math> > <math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ [(3-2x)-(x+1)]</math> . <math>\ [(3-2x)+(x+1)]</math> > <math>\ 0 </math> :<math>\ (2-3x)</math> . <math>\ ()</math> > <math>\ 0 </math> :Realizamos sementerio :Rta <math>\ (-infinito, \frac{2}{3}) <math>\ (4,+infinito) </math>
==Fuciones== Los siguientes ejercicios fueron tomados del purcel octava edición Diga si la funcion es ó no es continua en tres y por que?
1.<math>\ f(x)=x^2-9</math> :<math>\ 3^2-9</math> :<math>\ 9-9</math> :<math>\ 0</math> Si es continua ya que toda funcion polinomial es continua. ---- 2.<math>\ h(x)=\frac{3}{x-3}</math> :<math>\frac {3}{3-3}</math> :<math>\frac {3}{0}</math> No es continua ya que el denominador de la funcion recional se hace <math>\ 0</math> ---- 3.<math>\ h(t)=\sqrt[2]{{t-4}} </math> :<math>\sqrt[2]{{3-4}} </math> :<math>\sqrt[2]{{-1}} </math> No es continua pues el termino n-esimo es par y el numero c no puede ser negativo ---- 4.<math>\ h(t)=\frac{|t-3|}{t-3} </math> :<math>\frac{|t-3|}{3-3} </math> :<math>\frac{|t-3|}{0} </math> No es continua ya que el denominador se hace cero ademas esta funcion es escalonada ---- 5.<math>\ g(f)=|f-2| </math> :<math>\ |3-2| </math> :<math>\ |1| </math> f(g(x))=\frac{6\sqrt[2]{{3x}}}{{{\sqrt[2]{{3x}}^2-9}}} </math> :<math>\ f(g(x))=\frac{6\sqrt[2]{{3x}}}{3x-9} </math> Dominio Todos los reales menos el 3 c.<math>\ Concidere las siguientes afirmaciones y diga si son verdaderas o falsas segun corresponda: 1. Si <math>\ f</math> es una funcion cuntinua en reales, entonces <math>\ Df(x)</math> existe para todo número real. :Esta afirmación es falsa. Porque Aunque existe un teorema que dice "deiferenciabilidad implica continuidad: Si <math>\ Df(c)</math> existe entonces un <math>\ f</math> que es continua", pero el inverso de este teorema es falso pues hay funciones que son continuas pero no diferenciables. Caso qu se da cuando la grafica de una función tiene esquinas ejemplo valor absoluto, ó la grafica de la funcion tiene recta tangente que se dirige hacia infinito en el eje de las y. ---- 2.Cualquier función trigonométrica es derivable en su dominio. :Esta afirmacion es verdadera. Pues con base en el aspecto de las graficas sen y cos supondriamos q son continuas, y deacuerdo con la definición de senx y cosx se sabe que las coordenadas en el punto p son (senx,cosx). Cuando x tinende a 0 vemos q p tiende a el punto (1,0) y por consiguiente cosx tiende a 1 y senx tiende a 0. Cuando realizamos los limites de estas dos funciones y nos demuetran que son continuas en todos los realoes hasta en el cero, sinedo así a el sen y el cos se pueden aplicar las formulas de la diccion de funciones y asi deducir q son continuas en todas partes. Pero si tenemos en cuenta que <math>\frac {f}{g}=</math> si <math>\ g(c)</math> debe ser diferente de <math>\ 0</math>. Hay que tener en cuenta que en la funcion tangente <math>\frac {senx}{cosx}=tangx</math> en tonces tangente seria discontinua en los puntos en que cosx vale 0. pero es importante ver que la afirmación nos habla de el dominio propio de la función siendo esta una restricción para que la firmación sea completamente verdadera. ---- 3.Si<math>\ f</math> es derivable en <math>\ x=a</math> y <math>\ Df(a)=0</math>, entoces<math>\ f</math>tiene un maximo o un minimo local en <math>\ x=a</math>. :Esta afirmación es falsa: pues sí <math>\ x=a</math> y es un punto en el que <math>\ Df(a)=a</math>, lo llamamos punto estacionario, pues la grafica se coloca en una trayectoria horizontal, ya que la recta tangentye es horizontal, Esto lo podemos sustentar por el teorema de los puntos criticos, que en ningun momento nos hablan de puntos maximos y minimos de una ves, para conocer estos devemos tener en cuenta el criterio de la segunda derivada ---- 4.Si <math>\ f(x)=a^x</math> con <math>\ a>1</math>, entonces <math>\ f</math> es concava en todo su dominio. :la afirmacion es vedadera. Las graficas que pertenecen a esta funcion con la restriccion que se da en la afirmacion solo se tama la seccion concaba de la función. <math>\ f(x)=a^x</math> con <math>\ a>1 </math> <math>\ Df(x)=a^x.ln.a</math> <math>\ Ln.y=x.ln.a</math> <math>\frac {Dy}{y}=ln.a </math> <math>\ Df=a^x.ln.x</math> <math>\ segundaDf=a^x-{(ln.a)}^2</math> ---- 5.Si <math>\ Df(a)</math> esta definida en un intervalo avierto <math>\ I</math> y <math>\ SegundaDf(a)>0,</math> para todo <math>\ a</math> pertenece <math>\ I</math>, entonces <math>\ f</math> es concava en <math>\ I</math>. :La afirmación es vedadera. Porque el teorema de concavidadque dice que sea dos veces derivable en el intervalo abierto <math>\ I</math>

y</math> :<math>\ Area= 2x(12-x^2)</math> y reemplazamos la ecuacion de la parabola en la del area :<math>\ Area=24x-2x^3</math> realizamos operaciones :<math>\ DArea=24-6x^2</math>derivamos la ecuacion resultante :<math>\ 24-6x^2=0</math>igualamos la ecuacion a cero para poder encontrar el valor de x y os

==RECTA TANGENTE EN UN PUNTO== I. Obtener la ecuación de la recta tangente en el punto dado. (Ejercicios tomados del libro: 7 ed. de Leithold)
1)<math>\ y = 9-x^3;(2,5)</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {9-(x+h)^2-(9-x^2)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {9-(x^2+2xh+h^2)-9+x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {9-x^2-2xh-h^2-9+x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {-2xh-h^2}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(-2x-h)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0} -2x-h</math> :<math>\ m(x)= -2(2)-(0)</math> :<math>\ m(x)= -4</math>
:<math>\ y-5=-4(x-2)</math> :<math>\ y-5=-4x+8</math> :<math>\ y=-4x+8+5</math> :<math>\ y=-4x+13</math> ---- 2)<math>\ y=2x^2+4x;(-2,0)</math>
:<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2(x+h)^2+4(x+h)-(2x^2+4x)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2(x^2+2xh+h^2)+4x+4h -2x^2-4x}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2x^2+4xh+2h^2+4x+4h -2x^2-4x}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {4xh+2h^2+4h}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(4x+2h+4)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}4x+2h+4</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 4(-2)+2(0)+4</math> :<math>\ m(x)= -4</math>
:<math>\ y-0=-4(x-(-2))</math> :<math>\ y=-4x-8</math> ---- 3)<math>\ y=x^3+3;(1,4)</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(x+h)^3+3-(x^3+3)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {x^3+3x^2h+3xh^2+h^3+3-x^3-3)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {3x^2h+3xh^2+h^3)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(3x^2+3xh+h^2)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0} 3x^2+3xh+h^2</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 3(1)^2+3(1)(0)+(0)^2</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 3</math>
:<math>\ y-4=3(x-1)</math> :<math>\ y-4=3x-3</math> :<math>\ y=3x-3+4</math> :<math>\ y=3x+1</math> ---- II)Determine la pendiente de la recta tangente en el punto <math>(x_1,f(x_1))</math> y dónde es horizontal
1)<math>\ f(x)= 3x^2-12x+8</math> :<math>\ f(x_1)= 3x_1^2-12x_1+8</math> :<math>\ f(x_1+h)= 3(x_1+h)^2-12(x_1+h)+8</math>
:<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(3(x_1+h)^2-12(x_1+h)+8) - (3x_1^2-12x_1+8)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(3(x_1^2+2x_1h+h^2)-12x_1-12h)+8) - (3x_1^2-12x_1+8)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {3x_1^2+6x_1h+3h^2-12x_1-12h+8 - 3x_1^2+12x_1-8)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {6x_1h+3h^2-12h}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(6x_1+3h-12)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}6x_1+3h-12</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 6x_1+3(0)-12</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 6x_1-12</math>
Horizontal
:<math>\ 6x_1-12=0</math> :<math>\ 6x_1=12</math> :<math>\ x_1=\frac {12}{6}</math> :<math>\ x_1=2</math>
:<math>\ y=3(2^2)-12(2)+8</math> :<math>\ y=-4</math> ---- 2)<math>\ f(x)= x^3+6x^2-9x-2</math>
:<math>\ f(x_1)= x_1^3+6x_1^2-9x_1-2</math> :<math>\ f(x_1+h)= (x_1+h)^3+6(x_1+h)^2-9(x_1+h)-2</math>
:<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {((x_1+h)^3+6(x_1+h)^2-9(x_1+h)-2) - (x_1^3+6x_1^2-9x_1-2)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {3x_1^2h+3x_1h^2+h^3-12x_1h-6h^2-9h}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(3x_1^2+3x_1h+h^2-12x_1-6h-9)}{h}</math> :<math>\ m(x)= lim_{h\to 0}3x_1^2+3x_1h+h^2-12x_1-6h-9</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 3x_1^2+3x_1(0)+(0)^2-12x_1-6(0)-9</math> :<math>\ m(x)= 3x_1^2-12x_1-9</math>
Horizontal
:<math>\ 3x_1^2-12x_1-9=0</math> :<math>\ (x_1-3)(3x+3)=0</math> :<math>\ x_1=3</math> :<math>\ x_1=1</math>
:<math>\ y_1=3(1)^2-12(1)-9</math> :<math>\ y_1=0</math>
:<math>\ y_3=3(3)^2-12(3)-9</math> :<math>\ y_3=-56</math>
==DERIVADAS TRIGONOMÉTRICAS==
1) <math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {(x-sen(x))^2}{x^2}</math> :=<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x^2-2xsen(x)+sen^2x}{x^2}</math> :=<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x^2}{x^2} - \lim_{x\to 0}\frac {2xsen^2x}{x^2}+ \lim_{x\to 0}\frac {sen^2x}{x^2}</math> :=<math>\ 1 - \lim_{x\to 0}\frac {2x}{x}\cdot\frac {senx}{x}+\frac {senx}{x}\cdot\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {senx}{x}</math> :=<math>\ 1 - (2)(1) + (1)(1)</math> :=<math>\ 1 - 2 + 1</math> :=<math>\ 0</math> : [[User:Marcelaburaglia|Marcelaburaglia]] ---- ==MÁXIMOS Y MÍNIMOS==
Estime los números críticos de cada función y luego encuentre los valores máximos y mínimos
1)<math>\ f(x) = x^3+7x^2-5x</math> :<math>\ f'(x) = x^3+7x^2-5x</math> :<math>\ f'(x) = 3x^2+14x-5</math> :<math>\ f'(x) = (x+5)(3x-1)</math> :<math>\ x = -5</math>
:<math>\ x = \frac {1}{3}</math> :<math>\ f_{(-5)}= (-5)^3+7(-5)^2-5(-5)</math> :<math>\ f_{(-5)}= -125+175+25</math> :<math>\ f_{(-5)}= 75</math> Máximo
:<math>\ f_{(\frac {1}{3})}= (\frac {1}{3})^3+7(\frac {1}{3})^2-5(\frac {1}{3})</math> :<math>\ f_{(\frac {1}{3})}= \frac {1}{27}+\frac {7}{9}-\frac {5}{3}</math> :<math>\ f_{(\frac {1}{3})}= \frac {-23}{27}</math> Mínimo [[User:Marcelaburaglia|Marcelaburaglia]] ---- ==DERIVACIÓN IMPLÍCITA==

=Recta Tangente= ---- Encuentre la ecuación de la recta tangente en el punto propuesto ---- 1)<math>\ {x^3y+y^3x=30}</math>
=Parcial= ---- 1)Se da una tabla de valores para ''f, g, f´'' y ''g´''
:''/ x / f(x) / g(x) / f´(x) / g´(x) /'' :/ 1 / 3 / 2 / 4 / 6 / :/ 2 / 1 / 8 / 5 / 7 / :/ 3 / 7 / 2 / 7 / 9 /
:Si ''h(x) = g(f(x))'', el valor de ''h´(1)'' es igual a: : a)4 b)5 c)36 d)24 e)30
:R/ ---- 2) ---- 3)Un rectángulo tiene dos vértices sobre el eje x y otros dos sobre la parabola <math>\ {y=12-x^2}</math> ¿Cuáles son las dimensiones del rectángulo de este tipo con área máxima? :<math>\ {A = (2x)(y)}</math> :<math>\ {A = (2x)(12-x^2)}</math> :<math>\ {A = 24x-2x^3}</math> :<math>\ {A^, = 24-6x^2}</math> :<math>\ {0 = 24-6x^2}</math> :<math>\ {24 = 6x^2}</math> :<math>\ {\frac {24}{6} = x^2}</math> :<math>\ {4 = x^2}</math> :<math>\ {\sqrt {4} = x}</math> :<math>\ {2 = x}</math> :<math>\ {y=12-x^2}</math> :<math>\ {y=12-(2)^2}</math> :<math>\ {y=12-4}</math> :<math>\ {y=8}</math> :<math>\ {A = (2(2))(8)}</math> :<math>\ {A = (4)(8)}</math> :<math>\ {A = 32}</math> --[[User:Jorgemontes|Jorgemontes]] 13:07, 19 Jul 2004 (UTC) ---- 4)

1)Hallar f´´(x) si f(x)=<math>\frac {x^2}{x^2-9}</math> :<math>f(x)=\frac {x^2}{x^2-9}</math> :<math>f'(x)=\frac {2x(x^2-9)-x^2(2x)}{(x^2-9)^2}</math> :<math>f'(x)=\frac {2x^3-18x-2x^3}{(x^2-9)^2}</math> :<math>f'(x)=\frac {-18x}{(x^2-9)^2}</math> :<math>f''(x)=\frac {-18(x^2-9)^2+18x(4x)(x^2-9)}{(x^2-9)^4}</math> :<math>f''(x)=\frac {(x^2-9)[-18(x^2-9)+72x^2]}{(x^2-9)^4}</math> :<math>f''(x)=\frac {54x^2+162}{(x^2-9)^3}</math> [[User:Monica|Monica]]
2)Derive:<math>\ x^3+2x^2+1</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {((x+h)^3+2(x+h)^2+1)-(x^3+2x^2+1)}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {x^3+hx^2+2hx^2+2h^2x+h^2x+h^3+2x^2+4hx+2h^2+1-x^3-2x^2-1}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {3hx^2+3h^2x+h^3+4hx+2h^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(h)(3x^2+3hx+h^2+4x+2h)}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\ 3x^2+3hx+h^2+4x+2h</math> :<math>\ 3x^2+3(0)x+(0)^2+4x+2(0)</math> .<math>\ 3x^2+4x</math> by: monica perez [[User:Monica|Monica]]
3)Hallar:<math>\frac {dy}{dx}</math> si <math>y^3-xy^2+cosxy=2</math> :<math>3y^2(\frac {dy}{dx})-y^2+x2y(\frac {dy}{dx})-sen(xy)(y+x(\frac {dy}{dx})=0</math> :<math>3y^2(\frac {dy}{dx})-2xy(\frac {dy}{dx})-x(\frac {dy}{dx})sen(xy)=y^2+ysenxy</math> :<math>(\frac {dy}{dx})(3y^2-2xy-xsen(xy))=y^2+ysenxy</math> :<math>(\frac {dy}{dx})=\frac {y^2+ysen(xy)}{3y^2-2xy-xsen(xy)}</math> [[User:Monica|Monica]] ---- 4)Derivar:<math>\frac {6}{x}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {\frac {6}{(x+h)}-\frac{6}{x}}{h}</math> :<math>lim_{h\to 0}\frac {\frac {-6h}{(x+h)(x)}}{h}</math> :<math>lim_{h\to 0}\frac {-6h}{(x+h)(x)(h)}</math> :<math>lim_{h\to 0}\frac {-6}{(x)(x+h)}</math> :<math>\frac {-6}{x^2}</math> [[User:Monica|Monica]]
5)Derivar:<math>\ f(x)=(x^2)senx</math> :<math>\ f'(x)=(x^2)senx+x^2cosx</math> :<math>\ f'(x)=(2x)senx+x^2cosx</math> :<math>\ f'(x)=(x)(2senx+xcosx)</math> [[User:Monica|Monica]]
6)Encuentre la ecuación de la recta tangente a la curva <math>x^\frac {2}{3}-y^\frac {2}{3}-2y=2</math> en el punto (1,-1)
:<math>\frac {2}{3}x^\frac {-1}{3}-\frac {2}{3}y^\frac {-1}{3}(\frac {dy}{dx})-2\frac ({dy}{dx})=0</math> :<math>\frac {dy}{dx}(-\frac {2}{3}y^\frac {-1}{3}-2)=-\frac {2}{3}x^\frac {-1}{3}</math> :<math>\frac {dy}{dx}=\frac {-\frac {2}{3}x^\frac {-1}{3}}{(-\frac {2}{3}y^\frac {-1}{3}-2)}</math> :<math>\frac {dy}{dx}=\frac {\frac {2}{3\sqrt [3]x}}{\frac {2}{3\sqrt [3]y}+2}</math> :<math>Mt=\frac {dy}{dx}(1,-1)=\frac {\frac {2}{3\sqrt [3]1}}{(\frac {2}{3\sqrt [3]-1}+2}</math> :<math>=\frac {\frac {2}{3}}{\frac {2}{3}+2}</math> <math>=\frac {\frac {2}{3}}{\frac {4}{3}}</math> :<math>=\frac {2}{4}=\frac {1}{2}=Mt</math>
Ya teniendo la pendiente reemplazamos:
:<math>(y+1)= \frac {1}{2}{x-1}</math> :<math>y= \frac {1}{2}x-\frac {1}{2}-1</math> :<math>y= \frac {1}{2}x-\frac {3}{2}</math>
===RAZON DE CAMBIO===
1)El radio de un circulo cambia a razón de <math>\frac {-2}{pi}m/sg</math>. ¿Cual es la razón de cambio del area del circulo cuando <math>r=10m</math>
:<math>\frac {dr}{dt}=\frac {-2}{pi}m/sg</math> y <math>r=10m</math> :<math>A=pir^2</math> :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=2pir\frac {dr}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=2pi(10)\frac {-2}{pi}</math> :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=-40m^2/sg</math> [[User:Monica|Monica]]
2)El area de la superficie de un cilindro circular recto se relaciona con el radio de la base r y la altura h mediante la ecuacion <math>s=2pir^2+2pirh</math> :a)¿Como se relaciona <math>\frac {ds}{dt},\frac {dr}{dt}</math> si h es constate? :b)¿Como se relaciona <math>\frac {ds}{dt}y\frac {dh}{dt}</math> si r es constate? :c)¿Como se relaciona <math>\frac {ds}{dt},\frac {dh}{dt};\frac {dr}{dt}</math> si ni r, ni t,ni h son constates?
a)<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=4pir\frac {dr}{dt}+2pih\frac {dr}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=(4pir+2pih)\frac {dr}{dt}</math>
b)<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=0+2pih\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=2pih\frac {dh}{dt}</math>
c)<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=4pir\frac {dr}{dt}+2pih\frac {dr}{dt}+2pir\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {ds}{dt}=2pi\frac {dr}{dt}(2r+h)+2pir\frac {dh}{dt}</math>
3)Un balón esférico se infla a razón de 100 pies cúbicos por minuto. ¿Cuál es la razón de crecimiento del radio en el instante en que el radio mide 10pies? :<math> V=\frac {dv}{dt}=100pies/mn</math> :<math>\frac {dr}{dt}=?</math> :<math>V=\frac {4pir^3}{3}</math> :<math>V=\frac {4pi3r^2}{3}(\frac {dr}{dt})</math> :<math>\frac {V}{\frac {4pi3r^2}{3}}=(\frac {dr}{dt})</math> :<math>\frac {100}{\frac {4pi3(10)^2}{3}}=(\frac {dr}{dt})</math> :<math>\frac {100}{\frac {3769.9}{3}}=(\frac {dr}{dt})</math> :<math>\frac {3769.9}{300}=(\frac {dr}{dt})</math> :<math>12.5=(\frac {dr}{dt})</math>
4)Dos automóviles parten de un mismo punto en igual momento. Uno se dirige hacia el norte a una velocidad constante de 25Km/h, y el otro se dirige al oriente a una velocidad constante de 60Km/h. ¿Qué tan rápido aumenta la distancia entre ellos después de 1 hora?
:<math>z^2=x^2+y^2</math> :<math>2z\frac {dz}{dt}=2x\frac {dx}{dt}+2y\frac {dy}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dz}{dt}=\frac {dx}{dt}+\frac {dy}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dz}{14}=\frac {d60}{140}+\frac {d25}{14}</math> :<math>dz=85Km/h</math>
5)Dos lados de un triangulo tiene longitudes de 12m y 15m respectivamente. El ángulo formado por ellos aumenta a razón de 2º/mn. ¿Con qué velocidad aumenta la longitud del tercer lado cuando el ángulo formado por los lados de longitud fija es 60º?
:<math>z^2=x^2+y^2-2xycostheta</math> :<math>z^2=144+225-2(12)(15)costheta</math> :<math>z^2=369-360costheta</math> :<math>z^2=369-360cos(60)</math> :<math>z^2=369-180</math> :<math>z=\sqrt [2]189</math> :<math>z=13.74</math> :<math>2z\frac {dz}{dt}=-360(-sentheta)\frac {dtheta}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dz}{dt}=\frac {180sentheta\frac {dtheta}{dt}}{z}</math> :<math>\frac {dz}{dt}=\frac {180sen(60)(2)}{13.74}</math> :<math>\frac {dz}{dt}=22.7m/mn</math>
==MAXIMOS Y MINIMOS===
¿Cuál es la máxima área que puede tener un triangulo rectángulo cuya hipotenusa tenga 5cms de largo? :<math>A=\frac {base*altura}{2}</math> :<math>z^2=x^2+y^2</math> :<math>z=5</math> :<math>25=x^2+y^2</math> :<math>\sqrt [2]{25-x^2}=y</math> :<math>A=\frac {x\sqrt [2]{25-x^2}}{2}</math> :<math>A'=\frac {1}{2}\sqrt [2]{25-x^2}+(\frac {x}{2})\frac {-2x }{2\sqrt [2]25-x^2}</math> :<math>A'=\frac {25-x^2-x^2}{2\sqrt [2]{25-x^2}}=0</math> :<math>25-2x^2=0</math> :<math>x=\sqrt [2]\frac {25}{2}</math> :<math>\sqrt [2]{25-\frac {25}{2}}= y</math> :<math>\sqrt [2]\frac {25}{2}= y</math> :<math>A=\frac {\sqrt [2]\frac {25}{2}*\sqrt [2]\frac {25}{2}}{2}</math> :<math>A=\frac {25}{4}cm^2</math>
2) Hay una ventana que tiene la forma de semicírculo montado sobre un rectángulo. El rectángulo es de cristal transparente, mientras que el semicírculo es de un cristal de color que transmite la mitad de luz por unidad de área que el transparente. El perímetro total es fijo. Hallar las proporciones de la ventana que proporcionen la mayor cantidad de luz. No considere el grosor del marco.
:<math>Perimetro=x+2y+\frac {2pir}{2}</math> :<math>P= x+2y+pi\frac {x}{2}</math> :<math>y= \frac {P}{2}-\frac {x}{2}-\frac {pix}{4}</math> :A= área del rectángulo + área del semicírculo :<math>A= x*y+\frac {pir^2}{4}</math> :<math>A= x(\frac {P}{2}-\frac {x}{2}-\frac {pix}{4})+\frac {pix^2}{16}</math> :<math>A= \frac {Px}{2}-\frac {x^2}{2}-\frac {pix^2}{4})+\frac {pix^2}{16}</math> :<math>A= \frac {P}{2}x-\frac {x^2}{2}-\frac {3pix^2}{16}</math> :<math>A'= \frac {P}{2}-x-\frac {6pix}{16}=0</math> :<math>\frac {P}{2}=x+\frac {6pix}{16}</math> :<math>\frac {P}{2}=x(1+\frac {3pi}{8})</math> :<math>\frac {P}{2}=x(\frac {8+3pi}{8})</math> :<math>\frac {8p}{2(8+3pi)}=x</math> :<math>\frac {4p}{8+3pi}=x</math>
Reemplazando en y
:<math>y= \frac {P}{2}-\frac {4P}{2(8+3pi)}-\frac {pi4P}{4(8+3pi)}</math> :<math>y= \frac {P}{2}-\frac {2P}{8+3pi}-\frac {piP}{8+3pi}</math> :<math>y= \frac {P(8+3pi)-4P-2piP}{2(8+3pi)}</math> :<math>y= \frac {8P+3Ppi-4P-2piP}{2(8+3pi)}</math> :<math>y= \frac {4P+piP}{2(8+3pi)}</math> :<math>y= \frac {P(4+pi)}{2(8+3pi)}</math> :<math>y= \frac {P(4+pi)}{16+6pi}</math>
3) Una hoja rectangular con perímetro de 36cm y con dimensiones de xcm por ycm se hace girar sobre uno de los lados de largo y para formar un cilindro. ¿Qué valores para y y x darán el volumen máximo?
:<math>2x+2y=36</math> :<math>y=18-x</math> :Vcilindro=(área de la base)(altura) :<math>V=pir^2h</math> :<math>V=pix^2y</math> :<math>V=pix^2(18-x)</math> :<math>V=18pix^2-pix^3</math> :<math>V'=36pix-3pix^2=0</math> :<math>3pix (12-x)=0</math> :<math>12-x=0</math> :<math>x=12</math> :<math>y=18-12</math> :<math>y=6</math>
SIENTO NO HABER PUESTO MAS PERO NO TENGO INTERNET EN CASA Y ESTO ES LO QUE PUDE HACER EN LA BIBLO DE LA U ESPERO QUE SIRVAN.

2):<math>\ f(x) = x^4-27x^2</math> :<math>\ f'(x) = 4x^3-54x</math> :<math>\ 0 = 4x^3-54x</math> :<math>\ 0 = x(4x^2-54)</math> :<math>\ x_1 = 0</math> :<math>\ x_2 = 4x^2-54</math> :<math>\ 4x^2 = 54</math> :<math>\ x^2 = \frac{54}{4}</math> :<math>\ x_2 = +\sqrt[2](54/4)=3.67</math> :<math>\ x_2 = -\sqrt[2](54/4)=-3.67</math>
:<math>\ f''(x) = 12x^2-54</math> :<math>\ f''(0) = 12(0)^2-54</math> :<math>\ f''(0) = -54</math> Máximo
:<math>\ f''(-3.67) = 12(-3.67)^2-54=107.6 </math> Minimo :<math>\ f''(+3.67) = 12(+3.67)^2-54=107.6</math> Minimo [[User:cristianmejia|cristianmejia]]
3):<math>\ f(x) = x^3-4x^2+4x-1</math> :<math>\ f'(x) = 3x^2-8x^+4</math> :<math>\ 0 = 3x^2-8x^+4</math> :<math>\ 0 = (x-2)(3x-2)</math>
:<math>\ x_1 = 2</math> :<math>\ x_2 = 3x-3</math> :<math>\ x_2 = 2/3 </math>
:<math>\ f''(x) = 6x-8</math> :<math>\ f''(2) = 6(2)-8= 4</math> Minimo :<math>\ f''(2/3) = 6(2/3)-8= 1</math> Minimo [[User:cristianmejia|cristianmejia]]
<math>\lim_{x\to -3}\frac {x^2-x-12}{x+3}</math>
:'''RESPUESTA''': :'''evaluando''': :<math>\lim_{x\to -3}\frac {x^2-x-12}{x+3}</math> =<math> \frac {(-3)^2-(-3)-12}{(-3)+3}</math> =<math> \frac {9+3-12}{0}</math> =<math> \frac {0}{0}</math>
:<math>\lim_{x\to -3}\frac {x^2-x-12}{x+3}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to -3}\frac {(x+3)(x-4)}{x+3}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to -3}{x-4}=-7</math>
[[User:cristianmejia|cristianmejia]]
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {\sqrt (2-t)-\sqrt 2}{t}</math>
:'''RESPUESTA''': :'''evaluando''':
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {\sqrt (2-t)-\sqrt 2}{t}</math> =<math>\frac {\sqrt (2-0)-\sqrt 2}{0}</math> =<math>\frac {\sqrt 2-\sqrt 2}{0}=\frac {0}{0}</math>
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {\sqrt (2-t)-\sqrt 2}{t}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {(\sqrt (2-t)-\sqrt 2)(\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2}{t(\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {(\sqrt (2-t))^2-(\sqrt 2)^2}{t(\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {(2-t)-2)}{t(\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {-t}{t(\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {-1}{\sqrt (2-t)+\sqrt 2}=\frac {-1}{\sqrt (2-0)+\sqrt 2}</math> =<math>\frac {-1}{\sqrt (2)+\sqrt 2}</math> =<math>\frac {-1}{2\sqrt 2}</math>
[[User:cristianmejia|cristianmejia]]
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x}{\sqrt (1+3x)-1}</math> :'''RESPUESTA''': :'''evaluando''':
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x}{\sqrt (1+3x)-1}</math> =<math>\frac {0}{\sqrt (1+3(0))-1}</math> =<math>\frac {0}{\sqrt 1-1}</math> =<math>\frac {0}{0}</math>
<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x}{\sqrt (1+3x)-1}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}{(\sqrt (1+3x)-1)(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}{(\sqrt (1+3x))^2(1)^2}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}{(1+3x)-(1)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {x(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}{3x)}</math> =<math>\lim_{x\to 0}\frac {(\sqrt (1+3x)+1)}{3}=\frac {(\sqrt (1+3(0))+1)}{3}</math> =<math>\frac {(\sqrt 1+1)}{3}=\frac {2}{3}</math>
[[User:cristianmejia|cristianmejia]]
<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {\sqrt[3]x-1}{\sqrt[2]x-1}</math> :'''RESPUESTA''': :'''evaluando''':
<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {\sqrt[3]x-1}{\sqrt[2]x-1}</math>= <math>\frac {\sqrt[3]1-1}{\sqrt[2]1-1}</math>= <math>\frac {1-1}{1-1}</math>= <math>\frac {0}{0}</math> Indeterminado
<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {\sqrt[3]x-1}{\sqrt[2]x-1}</math>

1)Derivar: :<math>\ y(x)=3x^3-4x^2+5x+16</math> :<math>\ y'(x)=9x^2-8x+5+0</math> :<math>\ y'(x)=9x^2-8x+5</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
2)Hallar el limite: :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {x^2-1}{x-1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {(x+1)(x-1)}{x-1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}{x+1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}{1+1}</math> :<math>\ 2</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
3)Hallar el limite: :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {2x^2-5x-3}{x-3}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 3}\frac {(2x+1)(x-3)}{(x-3)}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 3}{2x+1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 3}{2(3)+1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 3}{6+1}</math> :<math>\ 7</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
4)Con la formula de derivada en limite halle: :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}{2x^2}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2(x+h)^2-2x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2(x^2+2xh+h^2)-2x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2x^2+4xh+2h^2)-2x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {2x^2+4xh+2h^2-2x^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {4xh+2h^2}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {h(4x+2h)}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0} {4x+2h}</math> :<math>\ 4x</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
5)Con la formula de derivada en limite halle: :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}{senx}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {sen(x+h)-senx}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(senxcosh+senhcosx)-senx}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {senx(cosh-1)+senhcosx}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {senx(cosh-1)}{h} + \frac {senhcosx}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}senx \frac{(cosh-1)}{h} + cosx \frac{senh}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}senx(0)+ cosx (1)</math> :<math>\ cosx</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
6)Con la formula de derivada en limite halle: :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}{12x^2-6x+6}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(12(x+h)^2-6(x+h)+6)-(12x^2-6x+6)}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(12(x^2+2xh+h^2)-6x-6h+6-12x^2+6x-6}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {12x^2+24xh+12h^2-6x-6h+6-12x^2+6x-6}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {24xh+12h^2-6h}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}\frac {h(24x+12h-6)}{h}</math> :<math>\lim_{h\to 0}{24x+12h-6}</math> :<math>\ 24x-6</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
7)Hallar las derivadas en su maxima expresion de: :<math>\ y =x^4-x^3+3x^2</math> :<math>\ y''=4x^3-3x^2+6x</math> :<math>\ y'''=12x^2-6x+6</math> :<math>\ y''''=24x-6</math> :<math>\ y'''''=24</math> :<math>\ y''''''=0</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
8)Hallar la derivada de: :<math>\ y = \frac {x^4-1}{x^2}</math> :<math>\ y' = \frac {(x^2)(4x^3)-(4x^3-1)(2x)}{(x^2)^2}</math> :<math>\ y' = \frac {(4x^5)-(8x^4-2x)}{(x^2)^2}</math> :<math>\ y' = \frac {4x^5-8x^4+2x}{x^4}</math> [[User:JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN|JORGE MARIO MEDINA MARTIN]] 5:10, 13 Jul 2004
100)<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac {\sqrt[2]x-1}{\sqrt[3]x-1}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac{(\sqrt[2]x-1)(\sqrt[2]x+1)}{(\sqrt[3]x-1)(\sqrt[2]x+1)}</math> :<math>\lim_{x\to 1}\frac{(\sqrt[2]x)^2-(1)^2}{(\sqrt[3]x-1)(\sqrt[2]x+1)}</math>

Derive:<math>\ f(x)=5x-8 :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {5(x+h)-8-(5x-8)}{h}</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {5x+5h-8-5x+8}{h}</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {5h}{h}</math> :<math>\ 5</math>
---- Determine la derivada en x:(libro purcell) :<math>\ f(x)=ax^2+bx+c</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {a(x+h)^2+b(x+h)+c-(ax^2+bx+c)}{h}</math> : <math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {a(x^2+2xh+h^2)+bx+bh+c-ax^2-bx-c}{h}</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {ax^2+2axh+ah^2+bx+bh+c-ax^2-bx-c}{h}</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {h(2ax+ah+b)}{h}</math> :<math>\ 2ax+b</math>
---- Derive::<math>\ x^3+5x^2+6x+4</math> :<math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {(x+h)^3+5(x+h)^2+6(x+h)+4-(x^3+5x^2+6x+4)}{h}</math> : <math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {x^3+3x^2h+3xh^2+h^3+5x^2+10xh+5h^2+6x+6h+4-x^3-5x^2-6x-4}{h}</math> : <math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {3x^2h+3xh^2+6h^2+10xh+6h}{h}</math> : <math>\ lim_{h\to 0}\frac {h(3x^2+3xh+6h+10x)}{h}</math> : =<math>\ 3x^2+10x+6 </math> ---- Derive implícitamente:
:<math>\ y=(4-5x)^4 </math> : <math>\ 4(4-5x)^3(-5)</math> : =<math>\ -20(4-5x)^3</math> ---- encuentre y':
:<math>\ y=(3-6x^3)^8</math> : <math>\ y'=8(3-6x^3)^7(3-6x^3)</math> : <math>\ y'=8(3-6x^3)^7(-18x^2) </math> ---- Encuentre y': :<math>\ y=(x^3-3x+2)^9</math> : <math>\ y'=9(x^3-3x+2)^8(x^3-3x+2)</math> : <math>\ y'=9(x^3-3x+2)^8(3x^2-3)</math>
---- Encuentre y': :<math>\ y= sen^4(13x)</math> :<math>\ y=[sen(13x)]^4</math> :<math>\ y'=4[sen(13x)]^3[sen(13x)]</math> :<math>\ y'=4[sen(13x)]^3[cos(13x)](13x)</math> :<math>\ y'=4[sen(13x)]^3[cos(13x)](13)</math> :<math>\ y'=52cos(13x)sen^3(13x)</math>
---- (calculo purcell) 44)Derive:<math>\ y= sen^3(cos t)</math> :<math>\ y=[sen(cos t)]^3</math> :<math>\ y'=3[sen(cos t)]^2[sen(cos t)]</math> :<math>\ y'=3[sen(cos t)]^2[cos(cos t)](cos t)</math> :<math>\ y'=3[sen(cos t)]^2[cos(cos t)](-sen t)</math> :<math>\ y'=-3sen t sen^2(cos t)cos(cos t)]</math>
---- 45)Derive: :<math>\ y= sen^5(x^3+5x)</math> :<math>\ y= [sen(x^3+5x)]^5</math> :<math>\ y'=5[sen(x^3+5x)]^4[sen(x^3+5x)]</math> :<math>\ y'=5[sen(x^3+5x)]^4[cos(x^3+5x)](x^3+5x)</math> : <math>\ y'=5[sen(x^3+5x)]^4[cos(x^3+5x)](3x^2+5)</math> : <math>\ y'=5(3x^2+5)sen^4(x^3+5x)cos(x^3+5x)</math>
---- 46)Derive:<math>\ 4x^3+7xy^2=2y^3</math> :<math>\ 4x^3+7xy^2=2y^3</math> :<math>\ 12x^2+7x2yy'+7y^2=6y^2y'</math> :<math>\ 7x2yy'-6y^2y'=-7y^2-12x^2</math> :<math>\ y'(14xy-6y^2)=-7y^2-12x^2</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {-7y^2-12x^2}{14xy-6y^2}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {7y^2+12x^2}{6y^2-14xy}</math>
---- 47)Derive:<math>\ 9x^2+12y^2=32</math> :<math>\ 18x+24yy'=0</math> :<math>\ 24yy'=-18x</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {-18x}{24y}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {-3x}{4y}</math>
---- 48)Derive:<math>\ xy+5x^2-8y^3=1</math> :<math>\ xy'+y+10x-24y^2y'=0</math> :<math>\ xy'-24y^2y'=-y-10x</math> :<math>\ y'(x-24y^2)=-y-10x</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {-y-10x}{x-24y^2}</math> :<math>\ y'=\frac {y+10x}{24y^2-x}</math>
---- 1)(purcell 3.9)Un disco metálico se dilata con el calor. Si su radio aumenta a razón de 0.02 pulgadas por segundo.¿Con qué rapidez aumenta el área de una de sus caras, cuando su radio es de 8.1 pulgadas?
<math>\frac {dr}{dt}=0.02</math>
<math>\frac {da}{dt}=?/ r=8.1p</math>
La fórmula que nos permite llevar a cabo este ejercicio es: <math>\ A=Pir^2</math> :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=2Pir\frac {dr}{dt}</math>
reemplazo los valores conocidos, en la fórmula obtenida al derivar: :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=2(3.14)(8.1)(0.02)</math> :<math>\frac {dA}{dt}=1.01\frac {p^2}{s}</math> ----
(purcell 3.9)De un tubo sale arena a razon de 16 pies cúbicos por segundo. Si la arena al caer forma un montón cónico en el piso, cuya altura siempre es 1/4 del diámetro de la base. Qué tan rápido aumenta la altura cuando el montón es de 4 pies de altura?
El volúmen del cono de arena es: :<math>\ V=\frac {pir^2h}{3}</math>
h(t)= Altura del cono de arena en el instante t r(t)= Radio del circulo de la base del cono de arena v(t)=volumen del cono de arena <math>\frac {dh}{dt}=?/h=4 pies </math>
:<math>\frac {V(t)}{d(t)}=16 p^3</math>
La fórmula para el volúmen del cono, tiene una variable no deseada r; no es deseada puesto que no conocemos su razón dr/dt. entonces lo dejamos en un variable conocida:
sabemos que el diámetro es igual a decir 2r.
:<math>\ h=\frac {1}{4}diametro</math> :<math>\ h=\frac {1}{2}r</math> :<math>\ 2h=r</math>
Este resultado se reemplaza en la ecuación original. :<math>\ V=\frac {1\pi(2h)^2h}{3}</math> :<math>\ V=\frac {\pi4h^3}{3}</math> :<math>\frac {dv}{dt}=\frac {4\pi}{3}3h^2\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dv}{dt}\frac {1}{4pih^2}=\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dh}{dt}=16\frac {1}{4\pi(4)^2}</math> :<math>\frac {dh}{dt}=\frac {1}{4\pi}\frac {p}{s}</math> ----
(purcell 3.9)Una escalera de 20 pies está recargada contra un edificio. Si la perte inferior de la escalera se desliza a lo largo del pavimento alejándose directamente del edificio a una velocidad de 1 pie por segundo, ¿Qué tan rápido está descendiendo el extremo superior la escalera, cuando cuando el pie de la escalera está a 5 pies de la pared?
S=20 pies (la longitud de la escalera se toma como un valor constante) h(t)= Altura de la pared x(t)= Distancia desde el pie de la escalera hasta la pared
La fórmula a ultilizar en este ejercicio es pitágoras: :<math>\ s^2=x^2+h^2</math>
:<math>\frac {dx}{dt}=1\frac {p}{s}</math> :<math>\frac {dh}{dt}=?/x=5</math>
se reemplazan los valores conocidos en la fórmula original. :<math>\ (20)^2=x^2+h^2</math>
y se deriva: :<math>\ 0=2x\frac {dx}{dt}+2h\frac {dh}{dt}</math>
Como no conocemos el valor de h, lo encontramos despejandolo de la fómula original: :<math>\ s^2-x^2=h^2</math> :<math>\ (20)^2-(5)^2=h^2</math> :<math>\ 400-25=h^2</math> :<math>\ h=19,36</math>
Ahora el resultado se reemplaza: :<math>\ -2x\frac {dx}{dt}=2h\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\ -2(5)=2(19,36)\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {-10}{19,36}=\frac {dh}{dt}</math> :<math>\frac {dh}{dt}=-0,25</math>
El signo negativo indica que el cambio de h con respecto de t va disminuyendo.

{{recipesummary|Side Dish recipes|6|20 minutes|2}}
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Side dishes|Side Dishes]]
'''Tomatoes with Cheese Stuffing''' - The addition of cheese to the stuffing used in stuffed tomatoes means added flavor, as well as nutritive value in the form of protein, the food substance in which the tomatoes themselves are lacking. The bread crumbs used for the stuffing supply a large amount of carbohydrate, so that the completed dish, besides being a very attractive one, contains all the food principles in fairly large quantities. Stuffed tomatoes may be served as the main dish in a light meal or as a vegetable dish in a heavy meal.
==Ingredients== * 6 [[Cookbook:Tomato|tomatoes]] * 1 cup bread crumbs * 1 cup grated [[Cookbook:Cheese|cheese]] * 1/2 [[Cookbook:Teaspoon|tsp.]] [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 1/8 tsp. [[Cookbook:Pepper|black pepper]] * 2 [[Cookbook:Tablespoon|tbl.]] [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]] * 1/4 [[Cookbook:Cup|cup]] hot water
==Procedure== # Select medium-sized tomatoes and hollow out the centers, reserve pulp. # Mix the crumbs, cheese, salt, pepper, butter, and hot water with the pulp from the centers of the tomatoes. # Fill the tomatoes with this stuffing, place in a pan, and bake in a moderate oven until the tomato can be pierced easily with a fork. # Serve hot.
{{Gutenberg|9936}}

revision.text: I am preparing to teach a writing course at a university here in Minnesota. I received my BA at the University of Kansas in English Literature and Creative Writer. Doing work in a text book setting is kind of a new thing for me, so I hope that I don't go too crazy. Big words are not generally my thing. The work I want to accomplish with Wikibooks is going to be in the Literature department for the most part. I would also like to dabble in History, but it looks like there are a lot of articles in there already. I'll see what I can do.

revision.text:
{{recipesummary|Dessert recipes|6|1-6 hours|2}} {{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Dessert|Desserts]]
'''Apple Tapioca''' - The combination of fruit and tapioca is agreeable to most people. Peaches and apples, either fresh or canned, are used most often for this purpose. For this recipe, the apples should be somewhat sour, as there will then be more character to the dessert. Canned or fresh peaches or canned pineapple may be used in exactly the same way as apples. If canned fruit is used, not so much sugar nor baking in the oven will be necessary.
==Ingredients== *3/4 cup pearl [[Cookbook:Tapioca|tapioca]] or 1/2 c. minute tapioca (instant) *2 cups boiling water *1/2 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] *6 [[Cookbook:Apple|apples]] *1/2 cup [[Cookbook:Brown Sugar|brown sugar]] *1 teaspoon [[Cookbook:Cinnamon|cinnamon]] *1 tablespoon [[Cookbook:Butter|butter]]
==Procedure== #If pearl tapioca is used, soak it for 4 or 5 hours and then drain off all the water. Minute tapioca will need no soaking. Add the tapioca to the boiling water and salt. #Cook in a double boiler until the tapioca is entirely transparent. #Pare (peel) and core the apples. Place them in a buttered baking dish, fill each cavity with sugar and cinnamon, and place a piece of butter on top of each. #Pour the hot tapioca over these, place in a hot oven, and bake until the apples are soft. #Serve either hot or cold with sugar and cream.
==Notes, tips, and variations== This recipe was copied from "Woman's Institute Library of Cookery, Vol. 4: Volume 4: Salads and Sandwiches; Cold and Frozen Desserts; Cakes, Cookies and Puddings; Pastries and Pies" found at http://www.gutenberg.net/etext06/8loc410h.htm and wikified for this cookbook.

The Arabic alphabet consists of 17 shapes. The Arabic alphabet represents 28 constanants. In order for Arabic writing to represent 28 consonants with 17 shapes without ambiguity, dots are used. Later foreign languages took Arabic shapes, and added dots to make letters needed to represent their language correctly.
Early Arabic writing included no dots. The dots found today in Arabic writing were one of the first innovations that came after the spread of Arabic (after Islam). These dots make it clear what consonant is to be pronounced. Before the dots, people read the text without any dots. They could do this through experience, and using context to differentiate between words that sound different and look the same. Arabic Writing has been using dots since the dotting system was first invented.
A need for a rigid orthography (writing system) with no ambiguity arose in the early days of Islam. This was due to the influx of non-native speakers trying to read the language. With new converts unused to reading Arabic, they made mistakes while reading texts. Thus they would learn to pronounce a word incorrectly.
*Example: kitaab AND kutaab are not differentiated without the vowel marks. (which are not usually used) *Example: bint AND bayt are not differentiated in writing without using the dots (which are always used today)
To ensure the language remains intact, as well as keeping the pronunciation of religious text correct, rulers introduced ''the Dotting'' whereby dots and indicators were added to individual letters to help with pronunciation and to differentiate them from those based on the same form. First the dots were added, later on signs to indicate vowels were introduced in the same manner and for the same reasons.
Modern Arabic books and print media usually do not indicate the vowelling in the text. However, they do indicate the consonants (they are all fully dotted (not dotting a text correctly is considered a spelling mistake)). Educated and fluent speakers do not need the indication of the short vowels and are used to reading text without it. The short vowels are indicated to some extent in Children's books, when children learn to read.
As you begin to feel more comfortable with the script and text, your need for pronunciation indicators diminishes. All modern Arabic texts include the dotting of the forms which indicates what consonant is pronounced, but do not fully indicate the vowels.
The Qur'an provides an ideal text to practise your pronunciation of various letters and words. The feeling of intimidation when you first see an excerpt of the text is understandable. Should you experience this, there are a plethora of books that explain the concepts in easy step by step lessons.
